meanings.definition: Resembling a fork in shape or function.
meanings.sent1: The tree had a forky branch that split into two smaller branches.
meanings.sent2: The forky road led us to the picnic area.
meanings.sent3: The forky clouds in the sky looked like giant tuning forks.
meanings.sent4: His forky fingers deftly picked up the tiny pieces of the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The forky shadows of the trees danced on the grass in the evening light.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of a fork.
meanings.sent1: The forky tool was perfect for digging in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Her forky hair was always tangled and messy.
meanings.sent3: The forky cat toy kept the kitten entertained for hours.
meanings.sent4: His forky personality made him stand out in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The forky taste of the dish reminded her of her grandmother's cooking.
